reviewText: it is so nice to see real talent. people who could sing 30 plus years ago and they still haven't lost a beat. and the orchestra music is breathtaking....real old school style. everytime i have my friends over(they are all older than me)for a dinner party or just to hang out, they insist i put it on and i am more than happy to oblige. nobody wants it to end, it brings back alot of great memories for them. i just love great music, too young for memories(smile).i have to get more copies to give as gifts.this is definitly a must have.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Old School Soul Party is another one in a series of the T. J. Lubinsky productions that seek to capture R&B greats in live performances for posterity. This release blends mostly very recent shows with shows from earlier years and does it wonderfully. The picture quality is great. As for the sound I found the 2 channel Prologic 2 preferable to the 5.1 surround. Regardless, the DVD is excellent overall with a very generous offering of songs that could easily have been issued as vol. 1 and 2 releases.
Title: N/A

reviewText: THE CD OLD SCHOOL, IS A FANTASTIC MIX OF A LOT OF THAT MUSIC WE HAVE NOT  HEARD FOR A LONG TIME. SAY FOR ALMOST 40 YEARS. THIS CD BRINGS ALL OF THAT BACK ALIVE BUT ONLY ON CD FORM AND ENHANCED SO THAT IT SOUNDS LIKE IT IS A LIVE CONCERT WITH MIXED ARTIST.DO YOURSELF. IF YOU ARE A BABY BOOMER FROM THE 50's, 60's OR EVEN 70's YOU WILL LOVE THIE COMBINATION OF THE GREATEST ARTEST OF OUR TIME.LETS ALL LISTEN AND GET DOWN WITH THE MUSIC THAT WILL NEVER DIE AS LONG AS WE ARE HERE ON THIS EARTH. JOHN-DEMUDBUG
summary: OLD SCHOOL IS JUST THAT, ONLY IN CD. FORM

reviewText: My dad had me buy this for him and when I started watching it with him, I was blown away. I didn't realize how many songs I recognized. I in turn was happy that he made me get this because it truly is wonderful. My dad watched it everyday for a week or two! That's how much he loves it.

reviewText: this DVD is Slamming from start to finish. Feel Good soulful Music&arrangements that still are on Point. Vocals are strong as well. Audience Participation is felt as well. the Bands are on point as well. everybody knows all the songs from start to finish along with songs that have solos&trademark Riffs or Groove parts. a Must see Feel Good Event.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is an excellent video -- I thought it would be tapes from the 70's, but it's an updated version of the 70's stars -- they all still look good and sound good too!  You have to have this video in your collection!  I enjoyed it tremendously -- looked at it twice in succession, initially!  Buy it!  You won't be disappointed.
summary: Money Well Spent -- This One Is A Keeper
Title: N/A

reviewText: I own many music DVDs and this is certainly one of the best. Nicely produced, great quality, and jam-packed with Old School monster hits. Includes some classic footage in addition to the live performances. Personally, I wished the Philly Soul Flashback clip and the Stevie Wonder clip would not have been as abbreviated, but that in no way detracts from the overall value of the DVD. This is one DVD you'll never get tired of viewing. GET IT.
Title: N/A

reviewText: track listings: various artists LIVEnew attitude (Patti LaBelle), theme from shaft (Isaac Hayes), could it be i'm falling in love, disco inferno, didn't i/blow your mind this time (Wilbert Hart) papa was a rolling stone (Temptations Review), midnight train to georgia (classic clip), everybody plays the fool (The Main Ingredient & Cuba Gooding, Sr.), smiling faces sometimes (The Undisputed Truth), show and tell (Al Wilson), you are everything (Russell Thompkins Jr. & the NEW Stylistics), sukiyaki (A Taste Of Honey), superstition (classic clip), strokin' (Clarence Carter), and the beat goes on (The Whispers), reunited (Peaches & Herb), sideshow (Blue Magic), shame (Evelyn "CHAMPAGNE" King), medley> the 2nd time around, make that move, a night to remember (Howard Hewett), me & mrs. jones (Billy Paul), let's get it on (classic clip) sexual healing (classic clip).BONUS tracks: in the mood, & rock steady (The Whispers), groove line (Heatwave), love rollercoaster (The Ohio Players), never can say goodbye (Isaac Hayes), just don't want to be loney (Cuba Gooding Sr. & The Main Ingredient), rockin' roll baby, & betcha by golly-wow (Russell Thompkins Jr. & The NEW Stylistics), & don't leave me this way (Thelma Houston).i rated this LIVE CONCERT music DVD a 3 (fair) NOT INTERESTED in LIVE CONCERTS!!!!
summary: old school SOUL PARTY (DVD video) LIVE CONCERT
